intro: Hieracium brevivittatum, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it thrives in sunny conditions.
